Admin / Sales Assistant Job at May Publishing Limited




        
    

        
        May Publishing Limited is a vibrant and growing media house passionate about capturing stories through photography, videography, lifestyle events, and curated group tours.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Admin / Sales Assistant

Job Location: Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary

	We’re looking for a proactive, detail-oriented, and organized Admin/Sales Assistant to join our team.
	This role is central to keeping our operations efficient while strengthening client relationships and supporting sales growth.
	The Admin/Sales Assistant will manage daily administrative functions, assist with client communication, and support the sales process.
	You’ll be essential in ensuring our projects run smoothly and clients remain engaged and satisfied.


Key Responsibilities


	Administrative Support: Handle calls, emails, schedules, and general office tasks
	Client Coordination: Respond to inquiries, follow up on leads, and maintain excellent customer relations
	Sales Assistance: Promote services, secure bookings, prepare quotes, track leads, and support closing deals
	Record Keeping: Organize and maintain accurate files, project records, and client documentation

	Social Media & Communication: Assist with content posting, email updates, and basic digital outreach
	Inventory Management: Track and replenish supplies or equipment as needed.

	Strong organizational and interpersonal communication skills
	Proficiency in Microsoft Office or Google Workspace
	1–2 years of experience in admin, sales, or customer service preferred
	High attention to detail and a proactive, can-do mindset
	Ability to multitask and adapt in a fast-paced environment
	Interest in media, creative, or event industries is an added advantage.

	A collaborative and creative work environment
	Involvement in exciting media and lifestyle projects
	Opportunities for personal and career growth
	Competitive salary plus performance-based bonuses.

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Head of Accounts",
  "description": "AL-Ihsan Oil &amp; Gas Nigeria Limited,&nbsp;founded in 2013, emerged from humble beginnings with a clear vision: to establish a reputable presence in Nigeria&#39;s Oil &amp; Gas industry. Our mission is driven by a commitment to measurable efficiency, responsibility, and competitiveness, all while fostering sustainable growth and aligning with societal and environmental objectives.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Head of Accounts

Job Location:&nbsp;Ajah, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time
Firm: Oil and Gas

Job Summary


	The accountant will play a key role in ensuring effective, efficient, and professional operations of the Accounts Department, contributing to ensuring the highest standards of finance management are achieved.


Job Responsibilities
The candidate will be responsible for the:


	Preparing daily, monthly, and yearly reports and ensuring that necessary filings and payments are done on time.
	Supervise accounts Receivables, Accounts Payable and Inventory
	Manage the working capital of the business
	Drive the financial planning of the company by analyzing its performance and risks
	Manage relationships with financial partners.
	Ensure adherence to financial laws and guidelines
	Promotes collection efficiency
	Stimulate and monitor budget process company-wide.
	Budget Preparation
	Maintain Assets register listing / Assets transfer/disposal management
	Maintain and manage asset depreciation
	Payment of monthly staff salary, tax deductions, and all related calculations.
	Utilize accounting software and financial management systems to streamline processes and enhance accuracy.
	Collaborate with external auditors during audits and provide necessary documentation and explanations of financial transactions.
	Provide relevant management reports
	Perform special projects/tasks as needed.


Job Requirements &amp; Qualifications


	Minimum of HND or BSc in Accounting, Finance, or a related field.
	Professional Certificate such as The Institute of Chartered Accountants of Nigeria (ICAN), Associate Chartered Accountant (ACA) is an added advantage.
	Applicant must possess up to 5 years and above experience on the job.
	Proficient in accounting software such as Sage, Zoho Microsoft Excel, ERPNEXT experience is an added advantage, other ERP cloud-based accounting systems, etc.
	Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with attention to detail.
	Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
	Knowledge of financial regulations and reporting standards.
	Males preferred for gender balance.


Salary
N250,000 - N300,000 monthly&nbsp;excluding incentives.

Head of Accounts Job at AL-Ihsan Oil & Gas Nigeria Limited




        
    

        
        AL-Ihsan Oil & Gas Nigeria Limited, founded in 2013, emerged from humble beginnings with a clear vision: to establish a reputable presence in Nigeria's Oil & Gas industry. Our mission is driven by a commitment to measurable efficiency, responsibility, and competitiveness, all while fostering sustainable growth and aligning with societal and environmental objectives.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Head of Accounts

Job Location: Ajah, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time
Firm: Oil and Gas

Job Summary
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	The accountant will play a key role in ensuring effective, efficient, and professional operations of the Accounts Department, contributing to ensuring the highest standards of finance management are achieved.


Job Responsibilities
The candidate will be responsible for the:


	Preparing daily, monthly, and yearly reports and ensuring that necessary filings and payments are done on time.
	Supervise accounts Receivables, Accounts Payable and Inventory
	Manage the working capital of the business
	Drive the financial planning of the company by analyzing its performance and risks
	Manage relationships with financial partners.
	Ensure adherence to financial laws and guidelines
	Promotes collection efficiency
	Stimulate and monitor budget process company-wide.
	Budget Preparation
	Maintain Assets register listing / Assets transfer/disposal management
	Maintain and manage asset depreciation
	Payment of monthly staff salary, tax deductions, and all related calculations.
	Utilize accounting software and financial management systems to streamline processes and enhance accuracy.
	Collaborate with external auditors during audits and provide necessary documentation and explanations of financial transactions.
	Provide relevant management reports
	Perform special projects/tasks as needed.


Job Requirements & Qualifications


	Minimum of HND or BSc in Accounting, Finance, or a related field.
	Professional Certificate such as The Institute of Chartered Accountants of Nigeria (ICAN), Associate Chartered Accountant (ACA) is an added advantage.
	Applicant must possess up to 5 years and above experience on the job.
	Proficient in accounting software such as Sage, Zoho Microsoft Excel, ERPNEXT experience is an added advantage, other ERP cloud-based accounting systems, etc.
	Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with attention to detail.
	Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
	Knowledge of financial regulations and reporting standards.
	Males preferred for gender balance.


Salary
N250,000 - N300,000 monthly excluding incentives.

Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: careers@alihsanoilandgas.com using “Head of Account” as the subject of the mail.

title: Job Openings at 7treads Consults
content:
7treads Consults, a consultancy / recruitment services company, is recruiting to fill the following positions below:

1.) Fibre & Broadband Supervisor

Job Location: Nigeria

Responsibilities
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	Oversee the activities of fibre installers and field technicians.
	Ensure timely and high-quality customer installations and repairs.
	Monitor field performance and enforce operational standards.
	Provide technical guidance and support to field teams.
	Compile daily/weekly activity reports.
	Liaise with Airtel project managers and internal teams for project coordination.
	Ensure compliance with safety protocols and work procedures.


Requirements


	HND/B.Sc in Telecommunications, Engineering, ICT, or related fields
	Minimum of 2 - 3 years of experience in fibre/broadband operations.
	Strong leadership and supervisory skills.
	Excellent communication and reporting abilities.
	Good understanding of fibre network architecture and troubleshooting.
	Ability to manage teams and meet operational targets.


Application Closing Date: 9th December, 2025.

Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CVs to: mayetemitope@gmail.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email (Example:“Broadband Supervisor – Abuja”).

 

 

2.) Broadband Installer (Airtel)

Job Location: Lagos

Responsibilities


	Install, test, and activate fibre and broadband services at customer locations.
	Troubleshoot and resolve fibre connectivity issues.
	Perform routine maintenance on fibre lines and network equipment.
	Ensure all installations comply with technical and safety standards.
	Provide excellent customer service during field visits.
	Complete installation reports and documentation accurately.


Application Closing Date: 9th December, 2025.

Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: mayetemitope@gmail.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.

 

 

3.) Junior Backend Engineer

Job Location: Ikeja, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Responsibilities


	Develop, maintain, and optimize backend services and APIs.
	Work with Node.js to implement scalable server-side logic.
	Integrate and manage PostgreSQL and MongoDB databases.
	Collaborate with frontend developers, designers, and product teams.
	Write clean, maintainable, and well-documented code.
	Participate in code reviews and contribute to improving team standards.
	Handle version control and collaboration through Git.
	Troubleshoot, debug, and upgrade existing systems.


Required Skills


	Minimum 1 year of experience in backend development.
	Proficiency in Node.js
	Experience with PostgreSQL
	Experience with MongoDB
	Strong understanding of JavaScript and TypeScript
	Familiarity with Git and modern development workflows
	Ability to write clean and efficient backend logic
	Strong problem-solving and debugging skills.


Application Closing Date: 13th December, 2025.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: mayetemitope@gmail.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.
